title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Unspecified Functional Bowel Disorder
description: Official Rome IV diagnostic criteria for unspecified functional bowel disorder, a catch-all diagnosis for functional bowel symptoms that do not meet specific criteria for IBS, functional constipation, functional diarrhea, or functional abdominal bloating/distension. This diagnosis applies to patients with bowel symptoms not attributable to organic etiology that persist for ≥3 months with onset ≥6 months prior to diagnosis.

parameters.name: bowel_symptoms_duration
parameters.description: Bowel symptoms present for ≥3 months with symptom onset ≥6 months prior to diagnosis
options: yes - Patient has bowel symptoms for ≥3 months with onset ≥6 months ago meeting temporal criteria
no - Patient does not meet the temporal requirements (symptoms <3 months or onset <6 months ago)

parameters.name: symptoms_not_organic
parameters.description: Bowel symptoms not attributable to an organic etiology
options: yes - Symptoms are functional in nature without identifiable organic cause
no - Organic etiology identified or suspected for bowel symptoms

parameters.name: exclusion_ibs_criteria
parameters.description: Does not meet Rome IV criteria for Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
options: yes - Patient does not meet Rome IV criteria for IBS
no - Patient meets criteria for IBS

parameters.name: exclusion_functional_constipation
parameters.description: Does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional constipation
options: yes - Patient does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional constipation
no - Patient meets criteria for functional constipation

parameters.name: exclusion_functional_diarrhea
parameters.description: Does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional diarrhea
options: yes - Patient does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional diarrhea
no - Patient meets criteria for functional diarrhea

parameters.name: exclusion_functional_bloating
parameters.description: Does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional abdominal bloating/distension
options: yes - Patient does not meet Rome IV criteria for functional abdominal bloating/distension
no - Patient meets criteria for functional abdominal bloating/distension

parameters.name: exclusion_gi_bleeding
parameters.description: Exclusion of signs of gastrointestinal bleeding
options: yes - No evidence of gastrointestinal bleeding (melena, hematemesis, hematochezia)
no - Signs of gastrointestinal bleeding present requiring investigation

parameters.name: exclusion_iron_deficiency_anemia
parameters.description: Exclusion of unexplained iron deficiency anemia
options: yes - No unexplained iron deficiency anemia present
no - Unexplained iron deficiency anemia present requiring evaluation

parameters.name: exclusion_weight_loss
options: yes - No unintentional weight loss (>10% body weight over 6 months)
no - Unintentional weight loss present requiring evaluation

parameters.name: exclusion_abdominal_mass_lymphadenopathy
parameters.description: Exclusion of palpable abdominal mass or lymphadenopathy
options: yes - No palpable abdominal mass or lymphadenopathy on examination
no - Palpable abdominal mass or lymphadenopathy present

parameters.name: exclusion_family_history_colon_cancer
parameters.description: Exclusion of family history of colon cancer without appropriate screening
options: yes - No family history of colon cancer or appropriate screening completed
no - Family history of colon cancer present without appropriate screening

parameters.name: exclusion_age_over_50_without_screening
parameters.description: Exclusion of symptom onset after age 50 without cancer screening
options: yes - Symptoms did not begin after age 50 or appropriate cancer screening completed
no - Symptoms began after age 50 without appropriate cancer screening

parameters.name: exclusion_sudden_bowel_habit_change
parameters.description: Exclusion of sudden change in bowel habits
options: yes - No sudden change in bowel habits
no - Sudden change in bowel habits present requiring evaluation

result.name: rome_iv_unspecified_functional_bowel_disorder_diagnosis
result.description: Rome IV diagnostic assessment for unspecified functional bowel disorder based on fulfillment of all required criteria

ranges.description: Does not meet Rome IV criteria
ranges.interpretation: Patient does not fulfill Rome IV diagnostic criteria for unspecified functional bowel disorder. Either temporal criteria are not met, organic etiology is suspected, or patient meets criteria for a more specific functional bowel disorder (IBS, functional constipation, functional diarrhea, or functional abdominal bloating/distension). Consider appropriate evaluation based on specific criteria not met. If alarm symptoms are present, further investigation including imaging, endoscopy, and laboratory studies may be indicated.

Patient fulfills Rome IV diagnostic criteria for unspecified functional bowel disorder. This diagnosis applies to bowel symptoms not attributable to organic etiology that do not meet criteria for IBS, functional constipation, functional diarrhea, or functional abdominal bloating/distension disorders. Management should be guided by individual patient symptoms and severity. No specific standardized treatment exists, but symptom-directed therapy may include dietary modifications, probiotics, antispasmodics, or other supportive measures as clinically indicated.

Rome IV diagnostic questionnaires and tables for investigators and clinicians. Gastroenterology. 2016 May;150(6):1481-1491. doi: 10.1053/j.gastro.2016.02.014.
formula: Rome IV Unspecified Functional Bowel Disorder Diagnosis = ALL criteria must be met for ≥3 months (onset ≥6 months ago): (1) Bowel symptoms not attributable to organic etiology + (2) Does not meet criteria for IBS, functional constipation, functional diarrhea, or functional bloating + (3) Exclusion of all alarm symptoms (GI bleeding, anemia, weight loss, masses, family history without screening, age >50 without screening, sudden bowel habit changes)
notes: Rome IV diagnostic criteria for functional bowel disorders
Catch-all diagnosis for functional bowel symptoms not meeting specific criteria
All criteria must be fulfilled for positive diagnosis
Temporal requirement: symptoms ≥3 months with onset ≥6 months ago
Must exclude organic etiology through appropriate clinical evaluation
Patient must not meet criteria for more specific functional disorders
IBS criteria: recurrent abdominal pain with altered bowel habits
Functional constipation: difficult, infrequent, or incomplete defecation
Functional diarrhea: loose stools without abdominal pain
Functional bloating: bothersome abdominal bloating/distension
Alarm symptoms require immediate evaluation and exclude diagnosis
No standardized treatment exists - management is symptom-directed
May benefit from dietary modifications, probiotics, or antispasmodics
Patient education about functional nature important for management
Regular follow-up to monitor symptoms and response to interventions
Consider referral to gastroenterology for complex cases
Functional bowel disorders represent a spectrum rather than isolated entities
Significant overlap exists between different functional bowel disorders
Diagnosis may evolve over time as symptoms change or clarify
Quality of life assessment important for treatment planning
